Line 223: Line 223:
==== 3 February ====
==== 3 February ====
â
Amidst nighttime gunfire, 6 people were reported killed and 800 injured.<ref name="bloomberg3feb">http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-03/gunfire-erupts-in-cairo-as-mubarak-supporters-battle-egyptian-protesters.html</ref> A standoff took place in front of the Egyptian Museum in the early morning hours where rocks and petrol bombs were reported to be flying. Large-caliber shots were also reported to have been fired in the air by the army. There was also a heavy police presence at the museum following the standoff; and anti-government protesters were seen banging on metal railings while rocks were thrown at them. Pro-Mubarak protesters continued to throw Molotov cocktails at the anti-government demonstrators.<ref>[http://blogs.aljazeera.net/middle-east/2011/02/02/live-blog-feb-3-egypt-protests "Live blog 3 Feb - Egypt protests"] ''Al Jazeera Staff in Middle East'' - 2 February 2011 - Retrieved 2 February 2011.</ref> At least five people have been reported killed when fire was opened on protesters by the Mubarak supporters in Tahrir Square<ref>http://www.source.ly/10Ct9</ref>.
+
Amidst nighttime gunfire, 6 people were reported killed and more than 800 injured.<ref name="bloomberg3feb">http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-03/gunfire-erupts-in-cairo-as-mubarak-supporters-battle-egyptian-protesters.html</ref> A standoff took place in front of the Egyptian Museum in the early morning hours where rocks and petrol bombs were reported to be flying. Large-caliber shots were also reported to have been fired in the air by the army. There was also a heavy police presence at the museum following the standoff; and anti-government protesters were seen banging on metal railings while rocks were thrown at them. Pro-Mubarak protesters continued to throw Molotov cocktails at the anti-government demonstrators.<ref>[http://blogs.aljazeera.net/middle-east/2011/02/02/live-blog-feb-3-egypt-protests "Live blog 3 Feb - Egypt protests"] ''Al Jazeera Staff in Middle East'' - 2 February 2011 - Retrieved 2 February 2011.</ref> At least five people have been reported killed when fire was opened on protesters by the Mubarak supporters in Tahrir Square<ref>http://www.source.ly/10Ct9</ref>.
Many international journalists covering Egypt's unrest were detained, beaten, shouted at or threatened by pro-Mubarak protesters.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110203/D9L503U80.html |title=Journalists attacked, detained in Egypt |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-03}}</ref>
Many international journalists covering Egypt's unrest were detained, beaten, shouted at or threatened by pro-Mubarak protesters.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110203/D9L503U80.html |title=Journalists attacked, detained in Egypt |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-03}}</ref>
